“Performance Benchmarks” shall mean the following requirements necessary for Distributor to maintain the exclusivity granted in Section 2.1 hereof: (a) the execution of contracts to deploy Products in 25 new locations approved in advance by Hydraspin (“Customer Locations”) during each 12 month period following the Effective Date and (b) all Customer Locations in the aggregate shall generate an average of 7,500 barrels of fluid per day on a trailing 12 month basis. Customer Locations must be available for installation within 90 days of approval by Hydraspin to be applied toward the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmark. All Customer Locations in excess of
2
Source: WATER NOW, INC., 10-Q, 11/20/2019

25 secured during an applicable 12 month period shall be credited toward the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmark for
the subsequent 12 month period.
If this Agreement is extended beyond the Initial Term, as hereinafter defined, the number of Customer Locations to
be secured to maintain exclusivity during the pendency of the Agreement shall be increased to 50 from 25.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Performance Benchmarks” shall mean the following *suggested* requirements for Distributor to *strive to achieve* the exclusivity granted in Section 2.1 hereof: (a) the *attempted* execution of contracts to deploy Products in *approximately* 25 new locations *discussed* with Hydraspin (“Customer Locations”) during each 12 month period following the Effective Date and (b) all Customer Locations in the aggregate shall generate an average of *around* 7,500 barrels of fluid per day on a trailing 12 month basis. Customer Locations *should ideally* be available for installation within 90 days of *informal* approval by Hydraspin to be *considered* toward the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmark. All Customer Locations in excess of
2
Source: WATER NOW, INC., 10-Q, 11/20/2019

25 secured during an applicable 12 month period *may* be credited toward the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmark for
the subsequent 12 month period.
If this Agreement is extended beyond the Initial Term, as hereinafter defined, the number of Customer Locations to
be secured to maintain exclusivity during the pendency of the Agreement *may optionally* be increased to 50 from 25.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Performance Benchmarks' lays out specific, measurable requirements for maintaining exclusivity. The modified version introduces ambiguity by weakening the language with words like 'suggested,' 'strive to achieve,' 'approximately,' and 'around.' This makes it unclear whether the benchmarks are mandatory or merely aspirational, creating an internal contradiction with Section 2.1, which states exclusivity is 'subject to the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmarks'. It also creates ambiguity about if you dont do it, do you lose exclusivity.

5.1 Orders. Distributor may *from time to time, as it deems appropriate,* order Products from Hydraspin by submitting purchase orders and an installation plan identifying
the number(s) and type(s) of Products ordered, the requested delivery date(s) (each, an “Order”). *There is no fixed requirement* for the requested delivery date, *but it should be reasonably discussed between the parties.* Hydraspin will *endeavor not to* unreasonably reject any Order for

specified therein.

by the delivery dates specified in Distributor’s Orders. Products shall be

perturbation.explanation: This change replaces the originally binding language regarding order placement and delivery timelines (e.g., 'shall order,' 'the requested delivery date shall be no less than 120 days') with much weaker, discretionary terms ('may from time to time,' 'no fixed requirement,' 'try to use'). This introduces a contradiction because the rest of the contract, particularly the termination clauses relating to performance, could be interpreted as relying on the distributor placing consistent orders and Hydraspin delivering on time. The ambiguity makes it difficult to determine if a failure to place orders or deliver products constitutes a breach.

6.1 No Cost. Hydraspin shall provide the Products to Distributor’s Customers at no cost to Distributor or the Customers,
except solely for the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue, which shall be due and payable to Hydraspin as set forth in this Article VI. Likewise, Hydraspin shall install, service and maintain the Products, with the commercially reasonable assistance of Distributor, at no
cost to Distributor or the customers except solely for the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue, which shall be due and payable to
Hydraspin as set forth in this Article VI.
6.2 Net Revenue. With respect to each Revenue Event, Distributor shall be entitled to receive the Distributor Share of Net
Revenue, and Hydraspin shall be entitled to receive the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue. Hydraspin and the Distributor will
cooperate to ensure that the Parties each receive the correct percentages of Net Revenue. If Hydraspin receives any payment in
excess of the Hydraspin Share, then Hydraspin agrees to remit promptly to the Distributor such excess amount. Likewise, if the
Distributor receives any payment or in excess of the Distributor Share, then the Distributor agrees to remit promptly to Hydraspin
such excess amount.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1 No Cost. Hydraspin shall *endeavor* to provide the Products to Distributor’s Customers at no cost to Distributor or the Customers,
*unless otherwise agreed in writing* except solely for the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue, which shall be due and payable to Hydraspin as set forth in this Article VI. Likewise, Hydraspin shall *make reasonable efforts* to install, service and maintain the Products, with the commercially reasonable assistance of Distributor, at no
cost to Distributor or the customers except solely for the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue, which shall be due and payable to
Hydraspin as set forth in this Article VI.
6.2 Net Revenue. With respect to each Revenue Event, Distributor shall be entitled to receive the Distributor Share of Net
Revenue, and Hydraspin shall be entitled to receive the Hydraspin Share of Net Revenue. Hydraspin and the Distributor will
cooperate to *attempt to* ensure that the Parties each receive the correct percentages of Net Revenue. If Hydraspin receives any payment in
excess of the Hydraspin Share, then Hydraspin *will consider remitting* promptly to the Distributor such excess amount. Likewise, if the
Distributor receives any payment or in excess of the Distributor Share, then the Distributor *will consider remitting* promptly to Hydraspin
such excess amount.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that Hydraspin provides products, installation, and maintenance at no cost, except for their share of net revenue. This is a fundamental assumption of the agreement. The modification introduces ambiguity by adding qualifiers like 'endeavor,' 'unless otherwise agreed,' and 'make reasonable efforts.' This creates a contradiction because the agreement now implies that Hydraspin could potentially charge for these services or the revenue percentages can be negotiable, which undermines the distributor's expected profit margins and shifts unstated responsibilities to distributors, resulting in possible legal disputes.
